nodes.text: The Thousand Moons system was located in the Circarpous sector, a part of the Slice portion of the Expansion Region. A decorative pattern of clothing incorporating both dots and various types of lines was common in the star system.

In 22 BBY, Padmé Amidala, the Galactic Republic senator of the planet Naboo, and Anakin Skywalker, a Jedi Padawan tasked with Amidala's protection against would-be assassins, traveled from the galactic capital world Coruscant to Naboo aboard the freighter Jendirian Valley. During their incognito journey, the Human pair wore clothing that disguised them as refugees, with Amidala wearing a dress of a young Thousand Moons matron and Skywalker's attire including a tunic decorated with the pattern that was popular in the Thousand Moons system.

The Thousand Moons system was first mentioned in the 2002 reference book Star Wars: Attack of the Clones: The Visual Dictionary, which was authored by David West Reynolds. Although the Legacy Era Campaign Guide, a sourcebook published by Wizards of the Coast on March 19, 2009 for use with the Star Wars Roleplaying Game, also introduced the moniker "Thousand Moons system" with respect to the planet Iego, The Essential Atlas, a reference book published in August 18 of the same year, differentiated between the two "Thousand Moon systems" by placing the former in grid square O-12 and the latter in square T-7. Jason Fry, co-author of The Essential Atlas, later confirmed on the Jedi Council Forums of TheForce.net that the separate placements were intentional.
